item.title: Check for Active Drupal Contrib Modules
item.description: Use the command: 1~$ drush pml --no-core --status=Enabled See sample below: 1~$ drush pml --no-core --status=Enabled 2----------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------- --------- ----------------- 3Package Name Status Version 4----------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------- --------- ----------------- 5Field types Address (address) Enabled 8.x-1.8 6Administration Admin Toolbar (admin_toolbar) Enabled 8.x-2.3 7Administration Admin Toolbar Extra Tools (admin_toolbar_tools) Enabled 8.x-2.3 8Spam control Antibot (antibot) Enabled 8.x-1.4 9Entity Automatic Entity Labels (auto_entitylabel) Enabled 8.x-3.0-beta3 10Content Display Calendar Link (calendar_link) Enabled 8.x-1.1 11Other Component Libraries (components) Enabled 8.

item.title: php modules location
item.description: 1Check the current extension directory with: 23php-config --extension-dir 4and you can change it by setting extension_dir in php.ini: 56extension_dir="/usr/lib64/php/modules" 7Don't forget to restart Apache. See https://serverfault.com/questions/316156/change-php-modules-directory
